channel.title: How To make old timey piano?
channel.description: So I’m using Auxy to make some background music for a movie type thing we have to do for my computer class, and we’re doing one in the 1930’s, and I wanted to make some old timey piano music, does anyone have any tips on that?

item.title: How To make old timey piano?
item.dc:creator: NotMiles
item.description:
If you don’t have premium, you can use a really soft sweeper to add to the vinyl feel.

Read full topic
item.source: How To make old timey piano?

item.title: How To make old timey piano?
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
what produk said…

here are some handy vinyl samples

just hit the three dots > export > open in > copy to Auxy

I think grain/origin are good for the pianos. maybe not a lot of vintage piano, otherwise it’ll sound a little too much like lofi

Read full topic
item.source: How To make old timey piano?

item.title: How To make old timey piano?
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
Might try vintage keys also. I know they’re not pianos, but they do have nice distortion on some tone controls and that plus high pass and some other tweaking might get you even closer

Read full topic
item.source: How To make old timey piano?

item.title: How To make old timey piano?
item.dc:creator: paxman
item.description:
You probably want a tiny bit of vibrato too, get the out-of-tune sound many pianos had in the 30s.

Read full topic
item.source: How To make old timey piano?

item.title: How To make old timey piano?
item.dc:creator: viiitality
item.description:
if you have a melody and some chords, you could use Noir and go on the highest octave, and with pitch automation, make it one octave higher, and it kinda sounds old-timey, especially with some highpass

Read full topic
item.source: How To make old timey piano?

item.title: How To make old timey piano?
item.dc:creator: NotMiles
item.source: How To make old timey piano?

item.title: How To make old timey piano?
item.dc:creator: Produk
item.description:
Use Grain with some gentle highpass and add vinyl scratches + static-y sounds in later
